    • partitionUniquely

      @NotNull public static <Q, T> @NotNull Map<Q,T> partitionUniquely(@NotNull @NotNull Iterable<T> thisIterable, @NotNull @NotNull Function<T,Q> mapper)
      Partitions each element into a Map where the keys are the value produced by the mapper block and the values are the elements of the Collection. If two elements map to the same key an IllegalStateException is thrown.

    • single

      public static <T> T single(@NotNull @NotNull Iterable<T> thisIterable)
      Returns a single element from this iterable, if only one exists. If no elements are in this iterable, or if there are more than one elements in it, an IllegalStateException is thrown

    • singleWhere

      public static <T> T singleWhere(@NotNull @NotNull Iterable<T> thisIterable, @NotNull @NotNull Predicate<T> cond)
      Returns a single item matching the given condition. If there is no such element or if multiple elements match the condition, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

    • intersect

      @NotNull public static <T> @NotNull Set<T> intersect(@NotNull @NotNull Iterable<T> thisIterable, @NotNull @NotNull Collection<T> that)
      Return the set intersection of these two collections.

      @NotNull public static <T> @NotNull List<T> toList(@NotNull @NotNull Iterable<T> thisIterable)
      If this Iterable is already a List, return this Iterable cast to a List. Otherwise create a new List and copy this Iterable into it.

    • toSet

      @NotNull public static <T> @NotNull Set<T> toSet(@NotNull @NotNull Iterable<T> thisIterable)
      If this Iterable is already a Set, return this Iterable cast to a Set. Otherwise create a new Set based on this Iterable.
